Bible.Verse: 20 And they brought him on horses: and he was buried at Jerusalem with his fathers in the city of David.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 21 And all the people of Judah took Azariah, which was sixteen years old, and made him king instead of his father Amaziah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 22 He built Elath, and restored it to Judah, after that the king slept with his fathers.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 23 In the fifteenth year of Amaziah the son of Joash king of Judah Jeroboam the son of Joash king of Israel began to reign in Samaria, and reigned forty and one years.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 24 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 25 He restored the coast of Israel from the entering of Hamath unto the sea of the plain, according to the word of the LORD God of Israel, which he spake by the hand of his servant Jonah, the son of Amittai, the prophet, which was of Gathhepher.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 26 For the LORD saw the affliction of Israel, that it was very bitter: for there was not any shut up, nor any left, nor any helper for Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 27 And the LORD said not that he would blot out the name of Israel from under heaven: but he saved them by the hand of Jeroboam the son of Joash.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 28 Now the rest of the acts of Jeroboam, and all that he did, and his might, how he warred, and how he recovered Damascus, and Hamath, which belonged to Judah, for Israel, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 14:
Bible.Verse: 29 And Jeroboam slept with his fathers, even with the kings of Israel; and Zachariah his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 1 In the twenty and seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 2 Sixteen years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned two and fifty years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jecholiah of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 3 And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father Amaziah had done;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 4 Save that the high places were not removed: the people sacrificed and burnt incense still on the high places.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 5 And the LORD smote the king, so that he was a leper unto the day of his death, and dwelt in a several house. And Jotham the king's son was over the house, judging the people of the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 6 And the rest of the acts of Azariah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 7 So Azariah slept with his fathers; and they buried him with his fathers in the city of David: and Jotham his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 8 In the thirty and eighth year of Azariah king of Judah did Zachariah the son of Jeroboam reign over Israel in Samaria six months.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as his fathers had done: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and smote him before the people, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 11 And the rest of the acts of Zachariah, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 12 This was the word of the LORD which he spake unto Jehu, saying, Thy sons shall sit on the throne of Israel unto the fourth generation. And so it came to pass.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 13 Shallum the son of Jabesh began to reign in the nine and thirtieth year of Uzziah king of Judah; and he reigned a full month in Samaria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 14 For Menahem the son of Gadi went up from Tirzah, and came to Samaria, and smote Shallum the son of Jabesh in Samaria, and slew him, and reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the rest of the acts of Shallum, and his conspiracy which he made, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then Menahem smote Tiphsah, and all that were therein, and the coasts thereof from Tirzah: because they opened not to him, therefore he smote it; and all the women therein that were with child he ripped up.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 17 In the nine and thirtieth year of Azariah king of Judah began Menahem the son of Gadi to reign over Israel, and reigned ten years in Samaria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 18 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not all his days from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 19 And Pul the king of Assyria came against the land: and Menahem gave Pul a thousand talents of silver, that his hand might be with him to confirm the kingdom in his hand.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Menahem exacted the money of Israel, even of all the mighty men of wealth, of each man fifty shekels of silver, to give to the king of Assyria. So the king of Assyria turned back, and stayed not there in the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 21 And the rest of the acts of Menahem, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 22 And Menahem slept with his fathers; and Pekahiah his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 23 In the fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekahiah the son of Menahem began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned two years.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 24 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 25 But Pekah the son of Remaliah, a captain of his, conspired against him, and smote him in Samaria, in the palace of the king's house, with Argob and Arieh, and with him fifty men of the Gileadites: and he killed him, and reigned in his room.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 26 And the rest of the acts of Pekahiah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 27 In the two and fiftieth year of Azariah king of Judah Pekah the son of Remaliah began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned twenty years.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 28 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD: he departed not from the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 29 In the days of Pekah king of Israel came Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and took Ijon, and Abelbethmaachah, and Janoah, and Kedesh, and Hazor, and Gilead, and Galilee, all the land of Naphtali, and carried them captive to Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 30 And Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, and smote him, and slew him, and reigned in his stead, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 31 And the rest of the acts of Pekah, and all that he did, behold, they are written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 32 In the second year of Pekah the son of Remaliah king of Israel began Jotham the son of Uzziah king of Judah to reign.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 33 Five and twenty years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jerusha, the daughter of Zadok.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 34 And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD: he did according to all that his father Uzziah had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 35 Howbeit the high places were not removed: the people sacrificed and burned incense still in the high places. He built the higher gate of the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 36 Now the rest of the acts of Jotham, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 37 In those days the LORD began to send against Judah Rezin the king of Syria, and Pekah the son of Remaliah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 15:
Bible.Verse: 38 And Jotham slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David his father: and Ahaz his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 1 In the seventeenth year of Pekah the son of Remaliah Ahaz the son of Jotham king of Judah began to reign.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 2 Twenty years old was Ahaz when he began to reign, and reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem, and did not that which was right in the sight of the LORD his God, like David his father.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 3 But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, yea, and made his son to pass through the fire, according to the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 4 And he sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places, and on the hills, and under every green tree.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then Rezin king of Syria and Pekah son of Remaliah king of Israel came up to Jerusalem to war: and they besieged Ahaz, but could not overcome him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 6 At that time Rezin king of Syria recovered Elath to Syria, and drave the Jews from Elath: and the Syrians came to Elath, and dwelt there unto this day.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 7 So Ahaz sent messengers to Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, saying, I am thy servant and thy son: come up, and save me out of the hand of the king of Syria, and out of the hand of the king of Israel, which rise up against me.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 8 And Ahaz took the silver and gold that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king's house, and sent it for a present to the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the king of Assyria hearkened unto him: for the king of Assyria went up against Damascus, and took it, and carried the people of it captive to Kir, and slew Rezin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 10 And king Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglathpileser king of Assyria, and saw an altar that was at Damascus: and king Ahaz sent to Urijah the priest the fashion of the altar, and the pattern of it, according to all the workmanship thereof.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Urijah the priest built an altar according to all that king Ahaz had sent from Damascus: so Urijah the priest made it against king Ahaz came from Damascus.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 12 And when the king was come from Damascus, the king saw the altar: and the king approached to the altar, and offered thereon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 13 And he burnt his burnt offering and his meat offering, and poured his drink offering, and sprinkled the blood of his peace offerings, upon the altar.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he brought also the brasen altar, which was before the LORD, from the forefront of the house, from between the altar and the house of the LORD, and put it on the north side of the altar.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 15 And king Ahaz commanded Urijah the priest, saying, Upon the great altar burn the morning burnt offering, and the evening meat offering, and the king's burnt sacrifice, and his meat offering, with the burnt offering of all the people of the land, and their meat offering, and their drink offerings; and sprinkle upon it all the blood of the burnt offering, and all the blood of the sacrifice: and the brasen altar shall be for me to enquire by.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 16 Thus did Urijah the priest, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 17 And king Ahaz cut off the borders of the bases, and removed the laver from off them; and took down the sea from off the brasen oxen that were under it, and put it upon a pavement of stones.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 18 And the covert for the sabbath that they had built in the house, and the king's entry without, turned he from the house of the LORD for the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 19 Now the rest of the acts of Ahaz which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 16:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Ahaz slept with his fathers, and was buried with his fathers in the city of David: and Hezekiah his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 1 In the twelfth year of Ahaz king of Judah began Hoshea the son of Elah to reign in Samaria over Israel nine years.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, but not as the kings of Israel that were before him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 3 Against him came up Shalmaneser king of Assyria; and Hoshea became his servant, and gave him presents.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the king of Assyria found conspiracy in Hoshea: for he had sent messengers to So king of Egypt, and brought no present to the king of Assyria, as he had done year by year: therefore the king of Assyria shut him up, and bound him in prison.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 5 Then the king of Assyria came up throughout all the land, and went up to Samaria, and besieged it three years.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 6 In the ninth year of Hoshea the king of Assyria took Samaria, and carried Israel away into Assyria, and placed them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 7 For so it was, that the children of Israel had sinned against the LORD their God, which had brought them up out of the land of Egypt, from under the hand of Pharaoh king of Egypt, and had feared other gods,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 8 And walked in the statutes of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they had made.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the children of Israel did secretly those things that were not right against the LORD their God, and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 10 And they set them up images and groves in every high hill, and under every green tree:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 11 And there they burnt incense in all the high places, as did the heathen whom the LORD carried away before them; and wrought wicked things to provoke the LORD to anger:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 12 For they served idols, whereof the LORD had said unto them, Ye shall not do this thing.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 13 Yet the LORD testified against Israel, and against Judah, by all the prophets, and by all the seers, saying, Turn ye from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 14 Notwithstanding they would not hear, but hardened their necks, like to the neck of their fathers, that did not believe in the LORD their God.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 15 And they rejected his statutes, and his covenant that he made with their fathers, and his testimonies which he testified against them; and they followed vanity, and became vain, and went after the heathen that were round about them, concerning whom the LORD had charged them, that they should not do like them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 16 And they left all the commandments of the LORD their God, and made them molten images, even two calves, and made a grove, and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served Baal.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 17 And they caused their sons and their daughters to pass through the fire, and used divination and enchantments, and sold themselves to do evil in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 18 Therefore the LORD was very angry with Israel, and removed them out of his sight: there was none left but the tribe of Judah only.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 19 Also Judah kept not the commandments of the LORD their God, but walked in the statutes of Israel which they made.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 20 And the LORD rejected all the seed of Israel, and afflicted them, and delivered them into the hand of spoilers, until he had cast them out of his sight.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 21 For he rent Israel from the house of David; and they made Jeroboam the son of Nebat king: and Jeroboam drave Israel from following the LORD, and made them sin a great sin.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 22 For the children of Israel walked in all the sins of Jeroboam which he did; they departed not from them;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 23 Until the LORD removed Israel out of his sight, as he had said by all his servants the prophets. So was Israel carried away out of their own land to Assyria unto this day.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 24 And the king of Assyria brought men from Babylon, and from Cuthah, and from Ava, and from Hamath, and from Sepharvaim, and placed them in the cities of Samaria instead of the children of Israel: and they possessed Samaria, and dwelt in the cities thereof.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 25 And so it was at the beginning of their dwelling there, that they feared not the LORD: therefore the LORD sent lions among them, which slew some of them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 26 Wherefore they spake to the king of Assyria, saying, The nations which thou hast removed, and placed in the cities of Samaria, know not the manner of the God of the land: therefore he hath sent lions among them, and, behold, they slay them, because they know not the manner of the God of the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 27 Then the king of Assyria commanded, saying, Carry thither one of the priests whom ye brought from thence; and let them go and dwell there, and let him teach them the manner of the God of the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and dwelt in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 29 Howbeit every nation made gods of their own, and put them in the houses of the high places which the Samaritans had made, every nation in their cities wherein they dwelt.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 30 And the men of Babylon made Succothbenoth, and the men of Cuth made Nergal, and the men of Hamath made Ashima,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 31 And the Avites made Nibhaz and Tartak, and the Sepharvites burnt their children in fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 32 So they feared the LORD, and made unto themselves of the lowest of them priests of the high places, which sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 33 They feared the LORD, and served their own gods, after the manner of the nations whom they carried away from thence.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 34 Unto this day they do after the former manners: they fear not the LORD, neither do they after their statutes, or after their ordinances, or after the law and commandment which the LORD commanded the children of Jacob, whom he named Israel;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 35 With whom the LORD had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, Ye shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 36 But the LORD, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt with great power and a stretched out arm, him shall ye fear, and him shall ye worship, and to him shall ye do sacrifice.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 37 And the statutes, and the ordinances, and the law, and the commandment, which he wrote for you, ye shall observe to do for evermore; and ye shall not fear other gods.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 38 And the covenant that I have made with you ye shall not forget; neither shall ye fear other gods.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 39 But the LORD your God ye shall fear; and he shall deliver you out of the hand of all your enemies.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 40 Howbeit they did not hearken, but they did after their former manner.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 17:
Bible.Verse: 41 So these nations feared the LORD, and served their graven images, both their children, and their children's children: as did their fathers, so do they unto this day.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 1 Now it came to pass in the third year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Hezekiah the son of Ahaz king of Judah began to reign.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 2 Twenty and five years old was he when he began to reign; and he reigned twenty and nine years in Jerusalem. His mother's name also was Abi, the daughter of Zachariah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 3 And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, according to all that David his father did.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 4 He removed the high places, and brake the images, and cut down the groves, and brake in pieces the brasen serpent that Moses had made: for unto those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it: and he called it Nehushtan.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 5 He trusted in the LORD God of Israel; so that after him was none like him among all the kings of Judah, nor any that were before him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 6 For he clave to the LORD, and departed not from following him, but kept his commandments, which the LORD commanded Moses.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the LORD was with him; and he prospered whithersoever he went forth: and he rebelled against the king of Assyria, and served him not.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 8 He smote the Philistines, even unto Gaza, and the borders thereof, from the tower of the watchmen to the fenced city.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 9 And it came to pass in the fourth year of king Hezekiah, which was the seventh year of Hoshea son of Elah king of Israel, that Shalmaneser king of Assyria came up against Samaria, and besieged it.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 10 And at the end of three years they took it: even in the sixth year of Hezekiah, that is the ninth year of Hoshea king of Israel, Samaria was taken.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 11 And the king of Assyria did carry away Israel unto Assyria, and put them in Halah and in Habor by the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 12 Because they obeyed not the voice of the LORD their God, but transgressed his covenant, and all that Moses the servant of the LORD commanded, and would not hear them, nor do them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 13 Now in the fourteenth year of king Hezekiah did Sennacherib king of Assyria come up against all the fenced cities of Judah, and took them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 14 And Hezekiah king of Judah sent to the king of Assyria to Lachish, saying, I have offended; return from me: that which thou puttest on me will I bear. And the king of Assyria appointed unto Hezekiah king of Judah three hundred talents of silver and thirty talents of gold.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Hezekiah gave him all the silver that was found in the house of the LORD, and in the treasures of the king's house.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 16 At that time did Hezekiah cut off the gold from the doors of the temple of the LORD, and from the pillars which Hezekiah king of Judah had overlaid, and gave it to the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the king of Assyria sent Tartan and Rabsaris and Rabshakeh from Lachish to king Hezekiah with a great host against Jerusalem. And they went up and came to Jerusalem. And when they were come up, they came and stood by the conduit of the upper pool, which is in the highway of the fuller's field.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 18 And when they had called to the king, there came out to them Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 19 And Rabshakeh said unto them, Speak ye now to Hezekiah, Thus saith the great king, the king of Assyria, What confidence is this wherein thou trustest?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 20 Thou sayest, (but they are but vain words,) I have counsel and strength for the war. Now on whom dost thou trust, that thou rebellest against me?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 21 Now, behold, thou trustest upon the staff of this bruised reed, even upon Egypt, on which if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt unto all that trust on him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 22 But if ye say unto me, We trust in the LORD our God: is not that he, whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah hath taken away, and hath said to Judah and Jerusalem, Ye shall worship before this altar in Jerusalem?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 23 Now therefore, I pray thee, give pledges to my lord the king of Assyria, and I will deliver thee two thousand horses, if thou be able on thy part to set riders upon them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 24 How then wilt thou turn away the face of one captain of the least of my master's servants, and put thy trust on Egypt for chariots and for horsemen?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 25 Am I now come up without the LORD against this place to destroy it? The LORD said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 26 Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebna, and Joah, unto Rabshakeh, Speak, I pray thee, to thy servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and talk not with us in the Jews' language in the ears of the people that are on the wall.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 27 But Rabshakeh said unto them, Hath my master sent me to thy master, and to thee, to speak these words? hath he not sent me to the men which sit on the wall, that they may eat their own dung, and drink their own piss with you?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 28 Then Rabshakeh stood and cried with a loud voice in the Jews' language, and spake, saying, Hear the word of the great king, the king of Assyria:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 29 Thus saith the king, Let not Hezekiah deceive you: for he shall not be able to deliver you out of his hand:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 30 Neither let Hezekiah make you trust in the LORD, saying, The LORD will surely deliver us, and this city shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 31 Hearken not to Hezekiah: for thus saith the king of Assyria, Make an agreement with me by a present, and come out to me, and then eat ye every man of his own vine, and every one of his fig tree, and drink ye every one the waters of his cistern:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 32 Until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of corn and wine, a land of bread and vineyards, a land of oil olive and of honey, that ye may live, and not die: and hearken not unto Hezekiah, when he persuadeth you, saying, The LORD will deliver us.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 33 Hath any of the gods of the nations delivered at all his land out of the hand of the king of Assyria?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 34 Where are the gods of Hamath, and of Arpad? where are the gods of Sepharvaim, Hena, and Ivah? have they delivered Samaria out of mine hand?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 35 Who are they among all the gods of the countries, that have delivered their country out of mine hand, that the LORD should deliver Jerusalem out of mine hand?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 36 But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king's commandment was, saying, Answer him not.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 18:
Bible.Verse: 37 Then came Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph the recorder, to Hezekiah with their clothes rent, and told him the words of Rabshakeh.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 1 And it came to pass, when king Hezekiah heard it, that he rent his clothes, and covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he sent Eliakim, which was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 3 And they said unto him, Thus saith Hezekiah, This day is a day of trouble, and of rebuke, and blasphemy; for the children are come to the birth, and there is not strength to bring forth.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 4 It may be the LORD thy God will hear all the words of Rabshakeh, whom the king of Assyria his master hath sent to reproach the living God; and will reprove the words which the LORD thy God hath heard: wherefore lift up thy prayer for the remnant that are left.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 5 So the servants of king Hezekiah came to Isaiah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Isaiah said unto them, Thus shall ye say to your master, Thus saith the LORD, Be not afraid of the words which thou hast heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 7 Behold, I will send a blast upon him, and he shall hear a rumour, and shall return to his own land; and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his own land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 8 So Rabshakeh returned, and found the king of Assyria warring against Libnah: for he had heard that he was departed from Lachish.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 9 And when he heard say of Tirhakah king of Ethiopia, Behold, he is come out to fight against thee: he sent messengers again unto Hezekiah, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 10 Thus shall ye speak to Hezekiah king of Judah, saying, Let not thy God in whom thou trustest deceive thee, saying, Jerusalem shall not be delivered into the hand of the king of Assyria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 11 Behold, thou hast heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands, by destroying them utterly: and shalt thou be delivered?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 12 Have the gods of the nations delivered them which my fathers have destroyed; as Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden which were in Thelasar?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 13 Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 14 And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 15 And Hezekiah prayed before the LORD, and said, O LORD God of Israel, which dwellest between the cherubims, thou art the God, even thou alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; thou hast made heaven and earth.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 16 LORD, bow down thine ear, and hear: open, LORD, thine eyes, and see: and hear the words of Sennacherib, which hath sent him to reproach the living God.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 17 Of a truth, LORD, the kings of Assyria have destroyed the nations and their lands,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 18 And have cast their gods into the fire: for they were no gods, but the work of men's hands, wood and stone: therefore they have destroyed them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 19 Now therefore, O LORD our God, I beseech thee, save thou us out of his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that thou art the LORD God, even thou only.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 20 Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, That which thou hast prayed to me against Sennacherib king of Assyria I have heard.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 21 This is the word that the LORD hath spoken concerning him; The virgin the daughter of Zion hath despised thee, and laughed thee to scorn; the daughter of Jerusalem hath shaken her head at thee.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 22 Whom hast thou reproached and blasphemed? and against whom hast thou exalted thy voice, and lifted up thine eyes on high? even against the Holy One of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 23 By thy messengers thou hast reproached the LORD, and hast said, With the multitude of my chariots I am come up to the height of the mountains, to the sides of Lebanon, and will cut down the tall cedar trees thereof, and the choice fir trees thereof: and I will enter into the lodgings of his borders, and into the forest of his Carmel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 24 I have digged and drunk strange waters, and with the sole of my feet have I dried up all the rivers of besieged places.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 25 Hast thou not heard long ago how I have done it, and of ancient times that I have formed it? now have I brought it to pass, that thou shouldest be to lay waste fenced cities into ruinous heaps.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 26 Therefore their inhabitants were of small power, they were dismayed and confounded; they were as the grass of the field, and as the green herb, as the grass on the house tops, and as corn blasted before it be grown up.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 27 But I know thy abode, and thy going out, and thy coming in, and thy rage against me.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 28 Because thy rage against me and thy tumult is come up into mine ears, therefore I will put my hook in thy nose, and my bridle in thy lips, and I will turn thee back by the way by which thou camest.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 29 And this shall be a sign unto thee, Ye shall eat this year such things as grow of themselves, and in the second year that which springeth of the same; and in the third year sow ye, and reap, and plant vineyards, and eat the fruits thereof.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 30 And the remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah shall yet again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 31 For out of Jerusalem shall go forth a remnant, and they that escape out of mount Zion: the zeal of the LORD of hosts shall do this.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 32 Therefore thus saith the LORD concerning the king of Assyria, He shall not come into this city, nor shoot an arrow there, nor come before it with shield, nor cast a bank against it.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 33 By the way that he came, by the same shall he return, and shall not come into this city, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 34 For I will defend this city, to save it, for mine own sake, and for my servant David's sake.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 35 And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the LORD went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 36 So Sennacherib king of Assyria departed, and went and returned, and dwelt at Nineveh.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 19:
Bible.Verse: 37 And it came to pass, as he was worshipping in the house of Nisroch his god, that Adrammelech and Sharezer his sons smote him with the sword: and they escaped into the land of Armenia. And Esarhaddon his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 1 In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And the prophet Isaiah the son of Amoz came to him, and said unto him, Thus saith the LORD, Set thine house in order; for thou shalt die, and not live.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 2 Then he turned his face to the wall, and prayed unto the LORD, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 3 I beseech thee, O LORD, remember now how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 4 And it came to pass, afore Isaiah was gone out into the middle court, that the word of the LORD came to him, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 5 Turn again, and tell Hezekiah the captain of my people, Thus saith the LORD, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee: on the third day thou shalt go up unto the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 6 And I will add unto thy days fifteen years; and I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will defend this city for mine own sake, and for my servant David's sake.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 7 And Isaiah said, Take a lump of figs. And they took and laid it on the boil, and he recovered.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 8 And Hezekiah said unto Isaiah, What shall be the sign that the LORD will heal me, and that I shall go up into the house of the LORD the third day?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 9 And Isaiah said, This sign shalt thou have of the LORD, that the LORD will do the thing that he hath spoken: shall the shadow go forward ten degrees, or go back ten degrees?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Hezekiah answered, It is a light thing for the shadow to go down ten degrees: nay, but let the shadow return backward ten degrees.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Isaiah the prophet cried unto the LORD: and he brought the shadow ten degrees backward, by which it had gone down in the dial of Ahaz.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 12 At that time Berodachbaladan, the son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a present unto Hezekiah: for he had heard that Hezekiah had been sick.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 13 And Hezekiah hearkened unto them, and shewed them all the house of his precious things, the silver, and the gold, and the spices, and the precious ointment, and all the house of his armour, and all that was found in his treasures: there was nothing in his house, nor in all his dominion, that Hezekiah shewed them not.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 14 Then came Isaiah the prophet unto king Hezekiah, and said unto him, What said these men? and from whence came they unto thee? And Hezekiah said, They are come from a far country, even from Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 15 And he said, What have they seen in thine house? And Hezekiah answered, All the things that are in mine house have they seen: there is nothing among my treasures that I have not shewed them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 16 And Isaiah said unto Hezekiah, Hear the word of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 17 Behold, the days come, that all that is in thine house, and that which thy fathers have laid up in store unto this day, shall be carried into Babylon: nothing shall be left, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 18 And of thy sons that shall issue from thee, which thou shalt beget, shall they take away; and they shall be eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 19 Then said Hezekiah unto Isaiah, Good is the word of the LORD which thou hast spoken. And he said, Is it not good, if peace and truth be in my days?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 20 And the rest of the acts of Hezekiah, and all his might, and how he made a pool, and a conduit, and brought water into the city, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 20:
Bible.Verse: 21 And Hezekiah slept with his fathers: and Manasseh his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 1 Manasseh was twelve years old when he began to reign, and reigned fifty and five years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hephzibah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, after the abominations of the heathen, whom the LORD cast out before the children of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 3 For he built up again the high places which Hezekiah his father had destroyed; and he reared up altars for Baal, and made a grove, as did Ahab king of Israel; and worshipped all the host of heaven, and served them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 4 And he built altars in the house of the LORD, of which the LORD said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 5 And he built altars for all the host of heaven in the two courts of the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 6 And he made his son pass through the fire, and observed times, and used enchantments, and dealt with familiar spirits and wizards: he wrought much wickedness in the sight of the LORD, to provoke him to anger.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he set a graven image of the grove that he had made in the house, of which the LORD said to David, and to Solomon his son, In this house, and in Jerusalem, which I have chosen out of all tribes of Israel, will I put my name for ever:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 8 Neither will I make the feet of Israel move any more out of the land which I gave their fathers; only if they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 9 But they hearkened not: and Manasseh seduced them to do more evil than did the nations whom the LORD destroyed before the children of Israel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the LORD spake by his servants the prophets, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 11 Because Manasseh king of Judah hath done these abominations, and hath done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, which were before him, and hath made Judah also to sin with his idols:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 12 Therefore thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Behold, I am bringing such evil upon Jerusalem and Judah, that whosoever heareth of it, both his ears shall tingle.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 13 And I will stretch over Jerusalem the line of Samaria, and the plummet of the house of Ahab: and I will wipe Jerusalem as a man wipeth a dish, wiping it, and turning it upside down.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 14 And I will forsake the remnant of mine inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 15 Because they have done that which was evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even unto this day.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 16 Moreover Manasseh shed innocent blood very much, till he had filled Jerusalem from one end to another; beside his sin wherewith he made Judah to sin, in doing that which was evil in the sight of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 17 Now the rest of the acts of Manasseh, and all that he did, and his sin that he sinned, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Manasseh slept with his fathers, and was buried in the garden of his own house, in the garden of Uzza: and Amon his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 19 Amon was twenty and two years old when he began to reign, and he reigned two years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Meshullemeth, the daughter of Haruz of Jotbah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 20 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, as his father Manasseh did.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 21 And he walked in all the way that his father walked in, and served the idols that his father served, and worshipped them:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 22 And he forsook the LORD God of his fathers, and walked not in the way of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 23 And the servants of Amon conspired against him, and slew the king in his own house.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 24 And the people of the land slew all them that had conspired against king Amon; and the people of the land made Josiah his son king in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 25 Now the rest of the acts of Amon which he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 21:
Bible.Verse: 26 And he was buried in his sepulchre in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 1 Josiah was eight years old when he began to reign, and he reigned thirty and one years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Jedidah, the daughter of Adaiah of Boscath.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 2 And he did that which was right in the sight of the LORD, and walked in all the way of David his father, and turned not aside to the right hand or to the left.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 3 And it came to pass in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, that the king sent Shaphan the son of Azaliah, the son of Meshullam, the scribe, to the house of the LORD, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 4 Go up to Hilkiah the high priest, that he may sum the silver which is brought into the house of the LORD, which the keepers of the door have gathered of the people:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 5 And let them deliver it into the hand of the doers of the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD: and let them give it to the doers of the work which is in the house of the LORD, to repair the breaches of the house,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 6 Unto carpenters, and builders, and masons, and to buy timber and hewn stone to repair the house.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 7 Howbeit there was no reckoning made with them of the money that was delivered into their hand, because they dealt faithfully.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 8 And Hilkiah the high priest said unto Shaphan the scribe, I have found the book of the law in the house of the LORD. And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 9 And Shaphan the scribe came to the king, and brought the king word again, and said, Thy servants have gathered the money that was found in the house, and have delivered it into the hand of them that do the work, that have the oversight of the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Shaphan the scribe shewed the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest hath delivered me a book. And Shaphan read it before the king.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 11 And it came to pass, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he rent his clothes.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the king commanded Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam the son of Shaphan, and Achbor the son of Michaiah, and Shaphan the scribe, and Asahiah a servant of the king's, saying,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 13 Go ye, enquire of the LORD for me, and for the people, and for all Judah, concerning the words of this book that is found: for great is the wrath of the LORD that is kindled against us, because our fathers have not hearkened unto the words of this book, to do according unto all that which is written concerning us.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 14 So Hilkiah the priest, and Ahikam, and Achbor, and Shaphan, and Asahiah, went unto Huldah the prophetess, the wife of Shallum the son of Tikvah, the son of Harhas, keeper of the wardrobe; (now she dwelt in Jerusalem in the college;) and they communed with her.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 15 And she said unto them, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, Tell the man that sent you to me,

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 16 Thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will bring evil upon this place, and upon the inhabitants thereof, even all the words of the book which the king of Judah hath read:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 17 Because they have forsaken me, and have burned incense unto other gods, that they might provoke me to anger with all the works of their hands; therefore my wrath shall be kindled against this place, and shall not be quenched.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 18 But to the king of Judah which sent you to enquire of the LORD, thus shall ye say to him, Thus saith the LORD God of Israel, As touching the words which thou hast heard;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 19 Because thine heart was tender, and thou hast humbled thyself before the LORD, when thou heardest what I spake against this place, and against the inhabitants thereof, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and hast rent thy clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard thee, saith the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 22:
Bible.Verse: 20 Behold therefore, I will gather thee unto thy fathers, and thou shalt be gathered into thy grave in peace; and thine eyes shall not see all the evil which I will bring upon this place. And they brought the king word again.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 1 And the king sent, and they gathered unto him all the elders of Judah and of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the king went up into the house of the LORD, and all the men of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem with him, and the priests, and the prophets, and all the people, both small and great: and he read in their ears all the words of the book of the covenant which was found in the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 3 And the king stood by a pillar, and made a covenant before the LORD, to walk after the LORD, and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes with all their heart and all their soul, to perform the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people stood to the covenant.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the door, to bring forth out of the temple of the LORD all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the grove, and for all the host of heaven: and he burned them without Jerusalem in the fields of Kidron, and carried the ashes of them unto Bethel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 5 And he put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; them also that burned incense unto Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the host of heaven.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 6 And he brought out the grove from the house of the LORD, without Jerusalem, unto the brook Kidron, and burned it at the brook Kidron, and stamped it small to powder, and cast the powder thereof upon the graves of the children of the people.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 7 And he brake down the houses of the sodomites, that were by the house of the LORD, where the women wove hangings for the grove.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 8 And he brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba, and brake down the high places of the gates that were in the entering in of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 9 Nevertheless the priests of the high places came not up to the altar of the LORD in Jerusalem, but they did eat of the unleavened bread among their brethren.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 10 And he defiled Topheth, which is in the valley of the children of Hinnom, that no man might make his son or his daughter to pass through the fire to Molech.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 11 And he took away the horses that the kings of Judah had given to the sun, at the entering in of the house of the LORD, by the chamber of Nathanmelech the chamberlain, which was in the suburbs, and burned the chariots of the sun with fire.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 12 And the altars that were on the top of the upper chamber of Ahaz, which the kings of Judah had made, and the altars which Manasseh had made in the two courts of the house of the LORD, did the king beat down, and brake them down from thence, and cast the dust of them into the brook Kidron.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 13 And the high places that were before Jerusalem, which were on the right hand of the mount of corruption, which Solomon the king of Israel had builded for Ashtoreth the abomination of the Zidonians, and for Chemosh the abomination of the Moabites, and for Milcom the abomination of the children of Ammon, did the king defile.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he brake in pieces the images, and cut down the groves, and filled their places with the bones of men.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 15 Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, both that altar and the high place he brake down, and burned the high place, and stamped it small to powder, and burned the grove.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 16 And as Josiah turned himself, he spied the sepulchres that were there in the mount, and sent, and took the bones out of the sepulchres, and burned them upon the altar, and polluted it, according to the word of the LORD which the man of God proclaimed, who proclaimed these words.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 17 Then he said, What title is that that I see? And the men of the city told him, It is the sepulchre of the man of God, which came from Judah, and proclaimed these things that thou hast done against the altar of Bethel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 18 And he said, Let him alone; let no man move his bones. So they let his bones alone, with the bones of the prophet that came out of Samaria.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 19 And all the houses also of the high places that were in the cities of Samaria, which the kings of Israel had made to provoke the Lord to anger, Josiah took away, and did to them according to all the acts that he had done in Bethel.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 20 And he slew all the priests of the high places that were there upon the altars, and burned men's bones upon them, and returned to Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 21 And the king commanded all the people, saying, Keep the passover unto the LORD your God, as it is written in the book of this covenant.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 22 Surely there was not holden such a passover from the days of the judges that judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 23 But in the eighteenth year of king Josiah, wherein this passover was holden to the LORD in Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 24 Moreover the workers with familiar spirits, and the wizards, and the images, and the idols, and all the abominations that were spied in the land of Judah and in Jerusalem, did Josiah put away, that he might perform the words of the law which were written in the book that Hilkiah the priest found in the house of the LORD.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 25 And like unto him was there no king before him, that turned to the LORD with all his heart, and with all his soul, and with all his might, according to all the law of Moses; neither after him arose there any like him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 26 Notwithstanding the LORD turned not from the fierceness of his great wrath, wherewith his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocations that Manasseh had provoked him withal.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 27 And the LORD said, I will remove Judah also out of my sight, as I have removed Israel, and will cast off this city Jerusalem which I have chosen, and the house of which I said, My name shall be there.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 28 Now the rest of the acts of Josiah, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 29 In his days Pharaohnechoh king of Egypt went up against the king of Assyria to the river Euphrates: and king Josiah went against him; and he slew him at Megiddo, when he had seen him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 30 And his servants carried him in a chariot dead from Megiddo, and brought him to Jerusalem, and buried him in his own sepulchre. And the people of the land took Jehoahaz the son of Josiah, and anointed him, and made him king in his father's stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 31 Jehoahaz was twenty and three years old when he began to reign; and he reigned three months in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 32 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 33 And Pharaohnechoh put him in bands at Riblah in the land of Hamath, that he might not reign in Jerusalem; and put the land to a tribute of an hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 34 And Pharaohnechoh made Eliakim the son of Josiah king in the room of Josiah his father, and turned his name to Jehoiakim, and took Jehoahaz away: and he came to Egypt, and died there.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 35 And Jehoiakim gave the silver and the gold to Pharaoh; but he taxed the land to give the money according to the commandment of Pharaoh: he exacted the silver and the gold of the people of the land, of every one according to his taxation, to give it unto Pharaohnechoh.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 36 Jehoiakim was twenty and five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Zebudah, the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 23:
Bible.Verse: 37 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his fathers had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 1 In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up, and Jehoiakim became his servant three years: then he turned and rebelled against him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the LORD sent against him bands of the Chaldees, and bands of the Syrians, and bands of the Moabites, and bands of the children of Ammon, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the LORD, which he spake by his servants the prophets.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 3 Surely at the commandment of the LORD came this upon Judah, to remove them out of his sight, for the sins of Manasseh, according to all that he did;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 4 And also for the innocent blood that he shed: for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood; which the LORD would not pardon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 5 Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and all that he did, are they not written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Judah?

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 6 So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the king of Egypt came not again any more out of his land: for the king of Babylon had taken from the river of Egypt unto the river Euphrates all that pertained to the king of Egypt.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 8 Jehoiachin was eighteen years old when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem three months. And his mother's name was Nehushta, the daughter of Elnathan of Jerusalem.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that his father had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 10 At that time the servants of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up against Jerusalem, and the city was besieged.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came against the city, and his servants did besiege it.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 12 And Jehoiachin the king of Judah went out to the king of Babylon, he, and his mother, and his servants, and his princes, and his officers: and the king of Babylon took him in the eighth year of his reign.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 13 And he carried out thence all the treasures of the house of the LORD, and the treasures of the king's house, and cut in pieces all the vessels of gold which Solomon king of Israel had made in the temple of the LORD, as the LORD had said.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he carried away all Jerusalem, and all the princes, and all the mighty men of valour, even ten thousand captives, and all the craftsmen and smiths: none remained, save the poorest sort of the people of the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 15 And he carried away Jehoiachin to Babylon, and the king's mother, and the king's wives, and his officers, and the mighty of the land, those carried he into captivity from Jerusalem to Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 16 And all the men of might, even seven thousand, and craftsmen and smiths a thousand, all that were strong and apt for war, even them the king of Babylon brought captive to Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 17 And the king of Babylon made Mattaniah his father's brother king in his stead, and changed his name to Zedekiah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 18 Zedekiah was twenty and one years old when he began to reign, and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem. And his mother's name was Hamutal, the daughter of Jeremiah of Libnah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 19 And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD, according to all that Jehoiakim had done.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 24:
Bible.Verse: 20 For through the anger of the LORD it came to pass in Jerusalem and Judah, until he had cast them out from his presence, that Zedekiah rebelled against the king of Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 1 And it came to pass in the ninth year of his reign, in the tenth month, in the tenth day of the month, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came, he, and all his host, against Jerusalem, and pitched against it; and they built forts against it round about.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 2 And the city was besieged unto the eleventh year of king Zedekiah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 3 And on the ninth day of the fourth month the famine prevailed in the city, and there was no bread for the people of the land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 4 And the city was broken up, and all the men of war fled by night by the way of the gate between two walls, which is by the king's garden: (now the Chaldees were against the city round about:) and the king went the way toward the plain.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 5 And the army of the Chaldees pursued after the king, and overtook him in the plains of Jericho: and all his army were scattered from him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 6 So they took the king, and brought him up to the king of Babylon to Riblah; and they gave judgment upon him.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 7 And they slew the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes, and put out the eyes of Zedekiah, and bound him with fetters of brass, and carried him to Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 8 And in the fifth month, on the seventh day of the month, which is the nineteenth year of king Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, came Nebuzaradan, captain of the guard, a servant of the king of Babylon, unto Jerusalem:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 9 And he burnt the house of the LORD, and the king's house, and all the houses of Jerusalem, and every great man's house burnt he with fire.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 10 And all the army of the Chaldees, that were with the captain of the guard, brake down the walls of Jerusalem round about.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 11 Now the rest of the people that were left in the city, and the fugitives that fell away to the king of Babylon, with the remnant of the multitude, did Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carry away.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 12 But the captain of the guard left of the poor of the land to be vinedressers and husbandmen.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 13 And the pillars of brass that were in the house of the LORD, and the bases, and the brasen sea that was in the house of the LORD, did the Chaldees break in pieces, and carried the brass of them to Babylon.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 14 And the pots, and the shovels, and the snuffers, and the spoons, and all the vessels of brass wherewith they ministered, took they away.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the firepans, and the bowls, and such things as were of gold, in gold, and of silver, in silver, the captain of the guard took away.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 16 The two pillars, one sea, and the bases which Solomon had made for the house of the LORD; the brass of all these vessels was without weight.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 17 The height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits, and the chapiter upon it was brass: and the height of the chapiter three cubits; and the wreathen work, and pomegranates upon the chapiter round about, all of brass: and like unto these had the second pillar with wreathen work.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 18 And the captain of the guard took Seraiah the chief priest, and Zephaniah the second priest, and the three keepers of the door:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 19 And out of the city he took an officer that was set over the men of war, and five men of them that were in the king's presence, which were found in the city, and the principal scribe of the host, which mustered the people of the land, and threescore men of the people of the land that were found in the city:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Nebuzaradan captain of the guard took these, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah:

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 21 And the king of Babylon smote them, and slew them at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away out of their land.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 22 And as for the people that remained in the land of Judah, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon had left, even over them he made Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the son of Shaphan, ruler.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 23 And when all the captains of the armies, they and their men, heard that the king of Babylon had made Gedaliah governor, there came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, even Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan the son of Careah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth the Netophathite, and Jaazaniah the son of a Maachathite, they and their men.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 24 And Gedaliah sware to them, and to their men, and said unto them, Fear not to be the servants of the Chaldees: dwell in the land, and serve the king of Babylon; and it shall be well with you.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 25 But it came to pass in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the seed royal, came, and ten men with him, and smote Gedaliah, that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldees that were with him at Mizpah.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 26 And all the people, both small and great, and the captains of the armies, arose, and came to Egypt: for they were afraid of the Chaldees.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 27 And it came to pass in the seven and thirtieth year of the captivity of Jehoiachin king of Judah, in the twelfth month, on the seven and twentieth day of the month, that Evilmerodach king of Babylon in the year that he began to reign did lift up the head of Jehoiachin king of Judah out of prison;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 28 And he spake kindly to him, and set his throne above the throne of the kings that were with him in Babylon;

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 29 And changed his prison garments: and he did eat bread continually before him all the days of his life.

Bible.Title: 2 Kings 25:
Bible.Verse: 30 And his allowance was a continual allowance given him of the king, a daily rate for every day, all the days of his life.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 1 Adam, Sheth, Enosh,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 2 Kenan, Mahalaleel, Jered,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 3 Henoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 4 Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 5 The sons of Japheth; Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 6 And the sons of Gomer; Ashchenaz, and Riphath, and Togarmah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the sons of Javan; Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Dodanim.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 8 The sons of Ham; Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 9 And the sons of Cush; Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raamah, and Sabtecha. And the sons of Raamah; Sheba, and Dedan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Cush begat Nimrod: he began to be mighty upon the earth.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Mizraim begat Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 12 And Pathrusim, and Casluhim, (of whom came the Philistines,) and Caphthorim.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 13 And Canaan begat Zidon his firstborn, and Heth,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 14 The Jebusite also, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 15 And the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 16 And the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 17 The sons of Shem; Elam, and Asshur, and Arphaxad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Arphaxad begat Shelah, and Shelah begat Eber.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 19 And unto Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; because in his days the earth was divided: and his brother's name was Joktan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Joktan begat Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 21 Hadoram also, and Uzal, and Diklah,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 22 And Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 23 And Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 24 Shem, Arphaxad, Shelah,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 25 Eber, Peleg, Reu,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 26 Serug, Nahor, Terah,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 27 Abram; the same is Abraham.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 28 The sons of Abraham; Isaac, and Ishmael.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 29 These are their generations: The firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 30 Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 31 Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 32 Now the sons of Keturah, Abraham's concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah. And the sons of Jokshan; Sheba, and Dedan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 33 And the sons of Midian; Ephah, and Epher, and Henoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these are the sons of Keturah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 34 And Abraham begat Isaac. The sons of Isaac; Esau and Israel.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 35 The sons of Esau; Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jaalam, and Korah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 36 The sons of Eliphaz; Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 37 The sons of Reuel; Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 38 And the sons of Seir; Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezar, and Dishan.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 39 And the sons of Lotan; Hori, and Homam: and Timna was Lotan's sister.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 40 The sons of Shobal; Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon; Aiah, and Anah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 41 The sons of Anah; Dishon. And the sons of Dishon; Amram, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 42 The sons of Ezer; Bilhan, and Zavan, and Jakan. The sons of Dishan; Uz, and Aran.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 43 Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the children of Israel; Bela the son of Beor: and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 44 And when Bela was dead, Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 45 And when Jobab was dead, Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 46 And when Husham was dead, Hadad the son of Bedad, which smote Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Avith.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 47 And when Hadad was dead, Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 48 And when Samlah was dead, Shaul of Rehoboth by the river reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 49 And when Shaul was dead, Baalhanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 50 And when Baalhanan was dead, Hadad reigned in his stead: and the name of his city was Pai; and his wife's name was Mehetabel, the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Mezahab.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 51 Hadad died also. And the dukes of Edom were; duke Timnah, duke Aliah, duke Jetheth,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 52 Duke Aholibamah, duke Elah, duke Pinon,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 53 Duke Kenaz, duke Teman, duke Mibzar,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 1:
Bible.Verse: 54 Duke Magdiel, duke Iram. These are the dukes of Edom.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 1 These are the sons of Israel; Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 2 Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 3 The sons of Judah; Er, and Onan, and Shelah: which three were born unto him of the daughter of Shua the Canaanitess. And Er, the firstborn of Judah, was evil in the sight of the LORD; and he slew him.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 4 And Tamar his daughter in law bore him Pharez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 5 The sons of Pharez; Hezron, and Hamul.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 6 And the sons of Zerah; Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara: five of them in all.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 7 And the sons of Carmi; Achar, the troubler of Israel, who transgressed in the thing accursed.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 8 And the sons of Ethan; Azariah.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 9 The sons also of Hezron, that were born unto him; Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 10 And Ram begat Amminadab; and Amminadab begat Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 11 And Nahshon begat Salma, and Salma begat Boaz,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 12 And Boaz begat Obed, and Obed begat Jesse,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 13 And Jesse begat his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimma the third,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 14 Nethaneel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 15 Ozem the sixth, David the seventh:

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 16 Whose sisters were Zeruiah, and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah; Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 17 And Abigail bare Amasa: and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmeelite.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 18 And Caleb the son of Hezron begat children of Azubah his wife, and of Jerioth: her sons are these; Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 19 And when Azubah was dead, Caleb took unto him Ephrath, which bare him Hur.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 20 And Hur begat Uri, and Uri begat Bezaleel.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 21 And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he married when he was threescore years old; and she bare him Segub.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 22 And Segub begat Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
Bible.Verse: 23 And he took Geshur, and Aram, with the towns of Jair, from them, with Kenath, and the towns thereof, even threescore cities. All these belonged to the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

Bible.Title: 1 Chronicles 2:
