Bible.Verse: 23 Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.

Bible.Title: Job 24:
Bible.Verse: 24 They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.

Bible.Title: Job 24:
Bible.Verse: 25 And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 1 Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 2 Dominion and fear are with him, he maketh peace in his high places.

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 3 Is there any number of his armies? and upon whom doth not his light arise?

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 4 How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 5 Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight.

Bible.Title: Job 25:
Bible.Verse: 6 How much less man, that is a worm? and the son of man, which is a worm?

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 1 But Job answered and said,

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 2 How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 3 How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 4 To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 5 Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 6 Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 7 He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 8 He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 9 He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 10 He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 11 The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 12 He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 13 By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.

Bible.Title: Job 26:
Bible.Verse: 14 Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 1 Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 2 As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 3 All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 4 My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 5 God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 6 My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 7 Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 8 For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 9 Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 10 Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 11 I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 12 Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 13 This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 14 If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 15 Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 16 Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 17 He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 18 He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 19 The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 20 Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 21 The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 22 For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.

Bible.Title: Job 27:
Bible.Verse: 23 Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 1 Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 2 Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 3 He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 4 The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 5 As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 6 The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 7 There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 8 The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 9 He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 10 He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 11 He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 12 But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 13 Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 14 The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 15 It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 16 It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 17 The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 18 No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 19 The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 20 Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 21 Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 22 Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 23 God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 24 For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 25 To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 26 When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 27 Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.

Bible.Title: Job 28:
Bible.Verse: 28 And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the LORD, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 1 Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 2 Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 3 When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 4 As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 5 When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 6 When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 7 When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 8 The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 9 The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 10 The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 11 When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 12 Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 13 The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 14 I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 15 I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 16 I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 17 And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 18 Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 19 My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 20 My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 21 Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 22 After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 23 And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 24 If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.

Bible.Title: Job 29:
Bible.Verse: 25 I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 1 But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 2 Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 3 For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 4 Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 5 They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 6 To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 7 Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 8 They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 9 And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 10 They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 11 Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 12 Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 13 They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 14 They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 15 Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 16 And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 17 My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 18 By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 19 He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 20 I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 21 Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 22 Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 23 For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 24 Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 25 Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 26 When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 27 My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 28 I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 29 I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 30 My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

Bible.Title: Job 30:
Bible.Verse: 31 My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 1 I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 2 For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 3 Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 4 Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 5 If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 6 Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 7 If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 8 Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 9 If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 10 Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 11 For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 12 For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 13 If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 14 What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 15 Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 16 If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 17 Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 18 (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 19 If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 20 If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 21 If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 22 Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 23 For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 24 If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 25 If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 26 If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 27 And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 28 This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 29 If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 30 Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 31 If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 32 The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 33 If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 34 Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 35 Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 36 Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 37 I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 38 If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 39 If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

Bible.Title: Job 31:
Bible.Verse: 40 Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 1 So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 2 Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 3 Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 4 Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 5 When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 6 And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 7 I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 8 But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 9 Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 10 Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 11 Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 12 Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 13 Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 14 Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 15 They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 16 When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 17 I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 18 For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 19 Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 20 I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 21 Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

Bible.Title: Job 32:
Bible.Verse: 22 For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 1 Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 2 Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 3 My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 4 The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 5 If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 6 Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 7 Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 8 Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 9 I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 10 Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 11 He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 12 Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 13 Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 14 For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 15 In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 16 Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 17 That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 18 He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 19 He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 20 So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 21 His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 22 Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 23 If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 24 Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 25 His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 26 He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 27 He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 28 He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 29 Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 30 To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 31 Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 32 If thou hast anything to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

Bible.Title: Job 33:
Bible.Verse: 33 If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 1 Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 2 Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 3 For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 4 Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 5 For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 6 Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 7 What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 8 Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 9 For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 10 Therefore hearken unto me ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 11 For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 12 Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 13 Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 14 If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 15 All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 16 If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 17 Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 18 Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 19 How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 20 In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 21 For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 22 There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 23 For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 24 He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 25 Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 26 He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 27 Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 28 So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 29 When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 30 That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 31 Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 32 That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 33 Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 34 Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 35 Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 36 My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.

Bible.Title: Job 34:
Bible.Verse: 37 For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 1 Elihu spake moreover, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 2 Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 3 For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 4 I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 5 Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 6 If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 7 If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 8 Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 9 By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 10 But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 11 Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 12 There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 13 Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 14 Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 15 But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:

Bible.Title: Job 35:
Bible.Verse: 16 Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 1 Elihu also proceeded, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 2 Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 3 I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 4 For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 5 Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 6 He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 7 He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 8 And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 9 Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 10 He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 11 If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 12 But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 13 But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 14 They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 15 He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 16 Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 17 But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 18 Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 19 Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 20 Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 21 Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 22 Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 23 Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 24 Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 25 Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 26 Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 27 For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 28 Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 29 Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 30 Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 31 For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 32 With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.

Bible.Title: Job 36:
Bible.Verse: 33 The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 1 At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 2 Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 3 He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 4 After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 5 God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 6 For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 7 He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 8 Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 9 Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 10 By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 11 Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 12 And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 13 He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 14 Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 15 Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 16 Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 17 How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 18 Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 19 Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 20 Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 21 And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 22 Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 23 Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

Bible.Title: Job 37:
Bible.Verse: 24 Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 1 Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 2 Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 3 Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 4 Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 6 Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 7 When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 8 Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 9 When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 10 And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 11 And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 12 Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 13 That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 14 It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 15 And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 16 Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 17 Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 18 Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 19 Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 20 That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 21 Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 22 Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 23 Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 24 By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 25 Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 26 To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 27 To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 28 Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 29 Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 30 The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 31 Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 32 Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 33 Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 34 Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 35 Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 36 Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 37 Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 38 When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 39 Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 40 When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

Bible.Title: Job 38:
Bible.Verse: 41 Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 1 Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 2 Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 3 They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 4 Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 5 Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 6 Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 7 He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 8 The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 9 Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 10 Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 11 Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 12 Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 13 Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 14 Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 15 And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 16 She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 17 Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 18 What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 19 Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 20 Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 21 He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 22 He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 23 The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 24 He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 25 He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 26 Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 27 Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 28 She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 29 From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

Bible.Title: Job 39:
Bible.Verse: 30 Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 1 Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 2 Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 3 Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 4 Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 5 Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 6 Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 7 Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 8 Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 9 Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 10 Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 11 Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 12 Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 13 Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 14 Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 15 Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 16 Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 17 He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 18 His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 19 He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 20 Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 21 He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 22 The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 23 Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 40:
Bible.Verse: 24 He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 1 Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 2 Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 3 Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 4 Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 5 Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 6 Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 7 Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 8 Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 9 Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 10 None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 11 Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 12 I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 13 Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 14 Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 15 His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 16 One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 17 They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 18 By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 19 Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 20 Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 21 His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 22 In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 23 The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 24 His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 25 When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 26 The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 27 He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 28 The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 29 Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 30 Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 31 He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 32 He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 33 Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

Bible.Title: Job 41:
Bible.Verse: 34 He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 1 Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 2 I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 3 Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 4 Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 5 I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 6 Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 7 And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 8 Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 9 So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 10 And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 11 Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 12 So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 13 He had also seven sons and three daughters.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 14 And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Kerenhappuch.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 15 And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 16 After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.

Bible.Title: Job 42:
Bible.Verse: 17 So Job died, being old and full of days.
